original: Carlström, Oscar Ludvig, riksdagsman, Sävsjö, f. 12/8/79 i Vrigstad, Jönköp. 1., av lantbr. Carl Magnusson o. Kristina Andersson. G. 04 m. Hulda Maria Lindquist. Barn: Erik f. 07, Ingeborg 10. — Genomg. hand:sk. Led. av riksd. andra kamm. sed. 17, led. av jordbr :utsk. o. utr :ndn, ordf. i andrakamm :gruppen, andre v. talman sed. 43, landstingsm., led. av för-valtn:utsk., av 26 års arb :lösh :sakk., 28 års lönekomm., 30 års mihavlön:-sakk., org:sakk. i skatteberedn., 34 års avdikn :sakk., 38 års jordbr :utredn., bespar :beredn. 40-42, statsrev. 41-42, led. av 45 års jordbr :försöksutredn., ordf. i komm. f. åtgärder f. främj. av ridhästaveln 45, ordf. i jordbr :komm. i Jönköp. 1. o. i Sv. Hand :bankens avd:kont. i Sävsjö. KV02kl, RNO.
translated:
Carlström, Oscar Ludvig was a member of parliament from Sävsjö. He was born on August 12th, 1879 in Vrigstad, Jönköping County as the first child of farmer Carl Magnusson and Kristina Andersson. He got married in 1904 to Hulda Maria Lindquist and they had two children: Erik, born in 1907, and Ingeborg, born in 1910. 

He attended a vocational school and served as a member of the second chamber of parliament since 1917. He was a member of the agricultural committee and the finance committee, as well as the group leader of the second chamber and the deputy speaker since 1943. He also served as a member of the county council, the administrative committee, the unemployment committee for 26 years, the salary committee for 28 years, the military salary committee for 30 years, the tax committee, the depreciation committee for 34 years, the agricultural investigation committee for 38 years, and the savings committee for 1940-1942. He was also a state auditor from 1941-1942 and a member of the agricultural experimentation committee for 45 years. He served as the chairman of the committee for the development of horse breeding in 1945 and as the chairman of the agricultural committee in Jönköping County and the branch of the Swedish Handelsbanken in Sävsjö. He was awarded the Order of the Polar Star, 2nd class, and the Royal Order of the North Star.
